/c/sf_pwiz/pwiz/util/SHA1.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002         100% free public domain implementation of the SHA-1 algorithm
00003         by Dominik Reichl <dominik.reichl@t-online.de>
00004         Web: http://www.dominik-reichl.de/
00005 
00006         Version 1.7 - 2006-12-21
00007         - Fixed buffer underrun warning which appeared when compiling with
00008           Borland C Builder (thanks to Rex Bloom and Tim Gallagher for the
00009           patch)
00010         - Breaking change: ReportHash writes the final hash to the start
00011           of the buffer, i.e. it's not appending it to the string any more
00012         - Made some function parameters const
00013         - Added Visual Studio 2005 project files to demo project
00014 
00015         Version 1.6 - 2005-02-07 (thanks to Howard Kapustein for patches)
00016         - You can set the endianness in your files, no need to modify the
00017           header file of the CSHA1 class any more
00018         - Aligned data support
00019         - Made support/compilation of the utility functions (ReportHash
00020           and HashFile) optional (useful when bytes count, for example in
00021           embedded environments)
00022 
00023         Version 1.5 - 2005-01-01
00024         - 64-bit compiler compatibility added
00025         - Made variable wiping optional (define SHA1_WIPE_VARIABLES)
00026         - Removed unnecessary variable initializations
00027         - ROL32 improvement for the Microsoft compiler (using _rotl)
00028 
00029         ======== Test Vectors (from FIPS PUB 180-1) ========
00030 
00031         SHA1("abc") =
00032                 A9993E36 4706816A BA3E2571 7850C26C 9CD0D89D
00033 
00034         SHA1("abcdbcdecdefdefgefghfghighijhijkijkljklmklmnlmnomnopnopq") =
00035                 84983E44 1C3BD26E BAAE4AA1 F95129E5 E54670F1
00036 
00037         SHA1(A million repetitions of "a") =
00038                 34AA973C D4C4DAA4 F61EEB2B DBAD2731 6534016F
00039 */
00040 
00041 #ifndef ___SHA1_HDR___
00042 #define ___SHA1_HDR___
00043 
00044 #if !defined(SHA1_UTILITY_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(SHA1_NO_UTILITY_FUNCTIONS)
00045 #define SHA1_UTILITY_FUNCTIONS
00046 #endif
00047 
00048 #include <memory.h> // Required for memset and memcpy
00049 
00050 #ifdef SHA1_UTILITY_FUNCTIONS
00051 #include <stdio.h>  // Required for file access and sprintf
00052 #include <string.h> // Required for strcat and strcpy
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00056 #include <stdlib.h>
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 // You can define the endian mode in your files, without modifying the SHA1
00060 // source files. Just #define SHA1_LITTLE_ENDIAN or #define SHA1_BIG_ENDIAN
00061 // in your files, before including the SHA1.h header file. If you don't
00062 // define anything, the class defaults to little endian.
00063 #if !defined(SHA1_LITTLE_ENDIAN) && !defined(SHA1_BIG_ENDIAN)
00064 #define SHA1_LITTLE_ENDIAN
00065 #endif
00066 
00067 // Same here. If you want variable wiping, #define SHA1_WIPE_VARIABLES, if
00068 // not, #define SHA1_NO_WIPE_VARIABLES. If you don't define anything, it
00069 // defaults to wiping.
00070 #if !defined(SHA1_WIPE_VARIABLES) && !defined(SHA1_NO_WIPE_VARIABLES)
00071 #define SHA1_WIPE_VARIABLES
00072 #endif
00073 
00074 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00075 // Define 8- and 32-bit variables
00076 
00077 #ifndef UINT_32
00078 
00079 #ifdef _MSC_VER // Compiling with Microsoft compiler
00080 
00081 #define UINT_8  unsigned __int8
00082 #define UINT_32 unsigned __int32
00083 
00084 #else // !_MSC_VER
00085 
00086 #define UINT_8 unsigned char
00087 
00088 #if (ULONG_MAX == 0xFFFFFFFF)
00089 #define UINT_32 unsigned long
00090 #else
00091 #define UINT_32 unsigned int
00092 #endif
00093 
00094 #endif // _MSC_VER
00095 #endif // UINT_32
00096 
00097 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00098 // Declare SHA1 workspace
00099 
00100 typedef union
00101 {
00102         UINT_8 c[64];
00103         UINT_32 l[16];
00104 } SHA1_WORKSPACE_BLOCK;
00105 
00106 class CSHA1
00107 {
00108 public:
00109 #ifdef SHA1_UTILITY_FUNCTIONS
00110         // Two different formats for ReportHash(...)
00111         enum
00112         {
00113                 REPORT_HEX = 0,
00114                 REPORT_DIGIT = 1
00115         };
00116 #endif
00117 
00118         // Constructor and destructor
00119         CSHA1();
00120         ~CSHA1();
00121 
00122         UINT_32 m_state[5];
00123         UINT_32 m_count[2];
00124         UINT_32 m_reserved1[1]; // Memory alignment padding
00125         UINT_8 m_buffer[64];
00126         UINT_8 m_digest[20];
00127         UINT_32 m_reserved2[3]; // Memory alignment padding
00128 
00129         void Reset();
00130 
00131         // Update the hash value
00132         void Update(const UINT_8* pData, UINT_32 uLen);
00133 #ifdef SHA1_UTILITY_FUNCTIONS
00134         bool HashFile(const char* szFileName);
00135 #endif
00136 
00137         // Finalize hash and report
00138         void Final();
00139 
00140         // Report functions: as pre-formatted and raw data
00141 #ifdef SHA1_UTILITY_FUNCTIONS
00142         void ReportHash(char* szReport, unsigned char uReportType = REPORT_HEX) const;
00143 #endif
00144         void GetHash(UINT_8* puDest) const;
00145 
00146 private:
00147         // Private SHA-1 transformation
00148         void Transform(UINT_32* pState, const UINT_8* pBuffer);
00149 
00150         // Member variables
00151         UINT_8 m_workspace[64];
00152         SHA1_WORKSPACE_BLOCK* m_block; // SHA1 pointer to the byte array above
00153 };
00154 
00155 #endif
